unit_learning_outcomes.description: Interpret test results and prepare a written report reflecting awareness of ethics and principles of giving feedback on test results
Apply knowledge to integrate testing into the design of an assessment program
Critique the principles of psychometrics as applied to best practice in the use of test instruments
Describe and critique relevant theories that underpin psychometric tests used by organisational psychologists for personnel selection, development, and coaching
Demonstrate basic skills in the administration of test instruments, providing test results feedback and undertaking performance assessment.
Interpret test results and prepare a written report

assessments.description: Students will design a test battery for given case study, and present this in a report format in 1500 words.
In pairs, student administer components of a cognitive ability and personality test and provide verbal feedback to each other
Each group critically evaluates a psychometric test, presents to the class in 30 minutes and prepares a handout.

assessments.assessment_title: A written report on test results
assessments.description: Students submit a written report of 1800 words on test results on a case scenario

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit provides students with an introduction to the different types of assessment instruments used by organisational psychologists and develops their skills in the use of standardised techniques and other forms of psychological assessment. Lectures are designed to increase awareness of the issues involved in psychological testing and professional practice, including critical evaluation of assessment instruments, cross-cultural issues, feedback and reporting.
data.title: Psychological Assessment and Evaluation

description: This unit provides students with an introduction to the different types of assessment instruments used by organisational psychologists and develops their skills in the use of standardised techniques and other forms of psychological assessment. title: Psychological Assessment and Evaluation
